intro: Meyna pierrei, commonly known as the dwarf orchid, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
